column2: 2. The average RM cost is for the Reference Weight. Calculate the RM cost for final product based on glrazing percentage. This will be the final RM Cost output.
3. Add fixed and variable overhead to final RM Cost.
4. Convert the to USD using the USD rate provided by user.
6. Subtract subsidy. Subsidy will be 8% of the cost or 80 cents, whichever is lower. This will give you the final CFR Cost for the output
